margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p:
I am directed by the Council of the Acclimatisation Society to request that you will call a meeting of the Trustees of the Royal Park for the purpose of bringing under notice the advisability of adding to the regulations recently […]
three illegible words. See G. Sprigg to M, 26 October 1864 (in this edition as 64-10-26c). rules for adding the kindling of fires or discharge of fireworks within the Royal Park.
The clause requested was not implemented until 'Regulations for the protection and management of the Royal Park' were published in Victoria Government Gazette, no. 19, 13 February 1866, p. 381: '6. Persons shall not be permitted to bring dogs into the park, nor shall any person discharge firearms or kindle any fire in the park'.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be
